translated: 4. Abhidharma Treatise on the Divisions of Various Matters, Scroll 7
Composed by Venerable Vasubandhu
Translated by the Song Dynasty Indian Tripiá¹­aka Master Guá¹‡abhadra

and Bodhiruci, Part 6, Section 4 of the Chapter on Distinguishing Aggregates: The three times and the events of the three times are included in the eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates, known by nine knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation, cognized by six consciousnesses, and conditioned by all defilements.

The suffering of suffering in the desire realm is included in the eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates, known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of subsequent cognition and the knowledge of cessation and path, cognized by six consciousnesses, and conditioned by all defilements of the desire realm.

The suffering of change in the form realm is included in fourteen realms, ten entrances, and five aggregates, known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of the truth of the path and the knowledge of cessation, cognized by four consciousnesses, and conditioned by all defilements of the form realm.

The suffering of conditioned existence in the formless realm is included in three realms, two entrances, and four aggregates, known by six knowledges excluding the knowledge of the truth of the path, the knowledge of cessation, and the knowledge of others' minds, cognized by one consciousness, and conditioned by all defilements of the formless realm.

Furthermore, painful feeling is the suffering of suffering, which is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges except for subsequent knowledge and the knowledge of cessation and the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is afflicted by all the defilements of the desire realm.

Pleasant feeling is the suffering of change, which is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is afflicted by all the defilements of the form realm, except for doubt and ignorance associated with it that have the desire realm and the unconditioned as their objects. It is afflicted by all the defilements of the desire realm.

Neither painful nor pleasant feeling is the suffering of formations, which is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is afflicted by all the defilements.ğŸ”½Dharmas with initial and sustained thought are included in eight realms, two sense bases, and four aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are afflicted by all the defilements of the two realms of desire and form.

Dharmas without initial thought but with sustained thought are included in three realms, two sense bases, and four aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are afflicted by all the defilements of the two realms of desire and form.

The dharmas without initial thought and without sustained thought are categorized as the thirteen sense fields, twelve sense bases, and five aggregates. They are known by ten knowledges, cognized by six consciousnesses, and are influenced by all the contaminations of the form and formless realms, as well as by the contaminations of the realm of desire that have a basis in the realm of desire.

The stage with initial thought and with sustained thought is categorized as the eighteen sense fields, twelve sense bases, and five aggregates. It is known by nine knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation, and cognized by six consciousnesses. It is influenced by all the contaminations of the two realms of desire and form.

The stage without initial thought but with sustained thought is categorized as the three realms, two sense bases, and five aggregates. It is known by nine knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation, and cognized by one consciousness. It is influenced by all the universal contaminations of the realm of form and by the contaminations eliminated by the path of cultivation.

The stage without initial thought and without sustained thought is categorized as the eleven sense fields, ten sense bases, and five aggregates. It is known by nine knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation, and cognized by four consciousnesses. It is influenced by all the contaminations of the realms of form and of non-form.

Bodily action is categorized as two sense bases, one sense field, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of the thoughts of others and the knowledge of cessation, and cognized by two consciousnesses. It is influenced by all the universal contaminations of the two realms of desire and form, as well as by the contaminations eliminated by the path of cultivation.
The same applies to verbal actions as to bodily actions.

Mental actions are included in one element, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are associated with all defilements.

Wholesome actions are included in three elements, two sense bases, and two aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by three consciousnesses. They are associated with all defilements of the three realms and with the defilements to be eliminated by cultivation.

Unwholesome actions are included in three elements, three sense bases, and two aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges except for the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by three consciousnesses. They are associated with all defilements of the desire realm.

Indeterminate actions are included in three elements, three sense bases, and two aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by three consciousnesses. They are associated with all defilements of the form and formless realms, with the two views of self in the desire realm, and with the defilements to be eliminated by cultivation.

Learned actions are included in one element, one sense base, and two aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges except for the knowledges of suffering, origin, and cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are not associated with any defilements.
The same applies to the non-learner's actions.

The non-learner's and non-non-learner's actions are included in three realms, three entrances, and two aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by three consciousnesses, and they are influenced by all the defilements.

The actions that are to be eliminated by seeing are included in one realm, one entrance, and one aggregate. They are known by eight knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are influenced by all the defilements that are to be eliminated by seeing.

The actions that are to be eliminated by cultivation are included in three realms, three entrances, and two aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by three consciousnesses. They are influenced by all the defilements that are to be eliminated by cultivation and by all the pervasive defilements.

The actions that are not to be eliminated are included in one realm, one entrance, and two aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origination, and the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are not influenced by the defilements.

Karma to be experienced in the present life, karma to be experienced in the next life, and karma to be experienced in subsequent lives are included in three realms, three entrances, and two aggregates, are known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path, are cognized by three consciousnesses, and are influenced by all the defilements of the desire realm, by the universal defilements of the form and formless realms, and by the defilements to be eliminated by cultivation.

Karma to be experienced as pleasant feeling is included in three realms, three entrances, and two aggregates, is known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path, is cognized by three consciousnesses, is influenced by the universal defilements of the desire and form realms, and by the defilements to be eliminated by cultivation.

Karma to be experienced as painful feeling is included in three realms, three entrances, and two aggregates, is known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of cause and effect and the knowledge of the path, is cognized by three consciousnesses, and is influenced by all the defilements of the desire realm.

Karma to be experienced as neither painful nor pleasant feeling is included in one realm, one entrance, and two aggregates, is known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of dharmas and the knowledge of cessation and the path, is cognized by one consciousness, is influenced by the universal defilements of the form and formless realms, and by the defilements to be eliminated by cultivation. Three dharmas are finished.

Mindfulness of the body is included in eleven elements, eleven sense bases, and one aggregate, is known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of the minds of others and the knowledge of cessation, is cognized by six consciousnesses, and is influenced by the universal contaminants of the two realms of desire and form, as well as by the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

Mindfulness of feeling is included in one element, one sense base, and one aggregate, is known by nine knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation, is cognized by one consciousness, and is influenced by all contaminants.

Mindfulness of the mind is included in seven elements, one sense base, and one aggregate, is known by nine knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation, is cognized by one consciousness, and is influenced by all contaminants.
Mindfulness of dharmas is included in one element, one sense base, and two aggregates, is known by ten knowledges, is cognized by one consciousness, and is influenced by all contaminants.

Furthermore, the wholesome with-outflows and without-outflows that arise from the path of the superior faculties of the body, the wholesome with-outflows and without-outflows that arise from the path of the superior faculties of feeling, mind, and dharmas, the four right efforts, and the four bases of supernatural power are included in the three realms, two entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation, and are cognized by one consciousness. They are influenced by the universal contaminants of the three realms and by the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

DhyÄna is included in the three realms, two entrances, and five aggregates. It is known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is influenced by the universal contaminants of the form realm and by the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

The truth of suffering is included in eighteen elements, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by six consciousnesses. It is influenced by all contaminants.
Just as the truth of suffering, the truth of accumulation is also like this.

The truth of cessation is not included in one element, one entrance, or any aggregates. It is known by six knowledges except for the knowledge of the minds of others, the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of accumulation, and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is not influenced by any contaminants.

The truth of the path is included in the three realms, two sense bases, and five aggregates. It is known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledges of suffering, origination, and cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness and is not associated with contaminants.

Loving-kindness, compassion, sympathetic joy, and equanimity are included in the three realms, two sense bases, and five aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of dharmas and the knowledges of cessation and path. They are cognized by one consciousness and are associated with contaminants of the form realm that are universal and those that are eliminated by cultivation.ğŸ”½The sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the sphere of nothingness are included in the three realms, two sense bases, and four aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of dharmas, the knowledge of others' minds, and the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness and are associated with all contaminants of the formless realm.

The sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is included in the three realms, two sense bases, and four aggregates. It is known by six knowledges, excluding the knowledge of dharmas, the knowledge of others' minds, and the knowledges of cessation and path. It is cognized by one consciousness and is associated with all contaminants of the formless realm.

The four noble lineages are included in the three realms, two sense bases, and five aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation, and are cognized by one consciousness. They are influenced by the universal contaminants of the three realms and by the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

The conditioned fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a are included in the three realms, two sense bases, and five aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges except for the knowledges of suffering, origination, and cessation, and are cognized by one consciousness. They are not influenced by the contaminants.

The unconditioned fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a are not included in any realm, sense base, or aggregate. They are known by six knowledges except for the knowledge of the minds of others and the knowledges of suffering, origination, and the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are not influenced by the contaminants.ğŸ”½The knowledge of dharmas is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by six knowledges except for inferential knowledge and the knowledges of suffering, origination, and cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is not influenced by the contaminants.

Inferential knowledge is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by six knowledges except for the knowledge of dharmas and the knowledges of suffering, origination, and cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is not influenced by the contaminants.

The knowledge of others' minds is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the contaminants of the form realm and the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

Ordinary knowledge is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the contaminants except for the view and the contaminants with impure objects.

The remaining knowledges are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by seven knowledges except for the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origination, and the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are not subject to the contaminants.

The discernment of meaning and the discernment of expression are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are the contaminants of the three realms and the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

The discernment of dharmas and the discernment of language are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are the contaminants of the two realms of desire and form and the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

Conditions are categorized as the eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. Nine knowledges know them, excluding the knowledge of cessation. The six consciousnesses are cognized. They are influenced by all contaminations.

Dependent conditions are categorized as eight realms, two entrances, and four aggregates. Nine knowledges know them, excluding the knowledge of cessation. One consciousness cognizes them. They are influenced by all contaminations.

Objective conditions and dominant conditions are categorized as the eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. Ten knowledges know them. The six consciousnesses cognize them. They are influenced by all contaminations.

Grasping food is categorized as three realms, three entrances, and one aggregate. Six knowledges know it, excluding the knowledge of subsequent cognition, the knowledge of others' minds, and the knowledge of the path of cessation. Four consciousnesses cognize it. It is influenced by all contaminations in the desire realm and by contaminations eliminated by cultivation.ğŸ”½The food of contact and the food of intention are categorized as one realm, one entrance, and one aggregate. Eight knowledges know them, excluding the knowledge of the path of cessation. One consciousness cognizes them. They are influenced by all contaminations.

The food of consciousness is categorized as seven realms, one entrance, and one aggregate. Eight knowledges know it, excluding the knowledge of the path of cessation. One consciousness cognizes it. It is influenced by all contaminations.

The desire stream is categorized as one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the contaminants of the desire realm.

The existence stream is categorized as one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of the Dharma and the knowledge of cessation and the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the contaminants of the form and formless realms.

The view stream is categorized as one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation and the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the contaminants associated with views and with impure objects, excluding those associated with views.

Ignorance and the ignorance stream are categorized as one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation and the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are all the contaminants, excluding ignorance with pure objects.
As with the streams, so it is with the yokes.

The grasping of desire is categorized as one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges excluding the inferential knowledge and the knowledge of cessation and the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the contaminants of the desire realm.

The attachment to views is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is defiled by the contaminants associated with views and the contaminants that are not associated with views but have a pure object.

The attachment to precepts and vows is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is defiled by all the contaminants that are eliminated by the path of seeing suffering, by all the pervasive contaminants that are eliminated by the path of seeing the origin of suffering, up to the contaminants that are eliminated by the path of seeing the path.

The attachment to the self is explained in detail as having contaminants.ğŸ”½Past dharmas, future dharmas, and present dharmas are included in eighteen realms, twelve sense bases, and five aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by six consciousnesses. They are defiled by all the contaminants.

Dharmas that are neither past, future, nor present are included in one realm, one sense base, and are not included in any aggregate. They are known by six knowledges except for the knowledge of the mental activities of others, the knowledge of suffering and accumulation, and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are not defiled by the contaminants.

The dharmas bound to the desire realm are included in eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of subsequent cognition and the knowledge of the path and cessation. They are cognized by six consciousnesses and are influenced by all the defilements of the desire realm.

The dharmas bound to the form realm are included in fourteen realms, ten entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the dharma and the knowledge of the path and cessation. They are cognized by four consciousnesses and are influenced by all the defilements of the form realm.

The dharmas bound to the formless realm are included in three realms, two entrances, and four aggregates. They are known by six knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the dharma, the knowledge of others' minds, and the knowledge of the path and cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness and are influenced by all the defilements of the formless realm.

The unconditioned dharmas are included in three realms, two entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges, excluding the knowledge of suffering and the knowledge of accumulation. They are cognized by one consciousness and are not influenced by the defilements.

The dharmas with good causes are included in eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by six consciousnesses and are influenced by all the universal defilements of the three realms and the defilements to be eliminated by cultivation.

The dharmas that are causes of the unwholesome are included in eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by six consciousnesses and are influenced by all the defilements of the desire realm.

The dharmas that are causes of the indeterminate are included in eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by six consciousnesses and are influenced by all the defilements.

The dharmas that are neither causes of the wholesome nor causes of the unwholesome nor causes of the indeterminate are not included in any realms, entrances, or aggregates. They are known by six knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the thoughts of others, the knowledge of suffering and accumulation, and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness and are not influenced by any defilements.

The dharmas that have conditions as objects are included in three realms, two entrances, and four aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness and are influenced by the defilements that have conditioned objects.

The dharmas that do not have conditions as objects are included in eight realms, two entrances, and four aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness and are influenced by all the defilements.

Dharmas with a condition as object and dharmas without a condition as object are included in the three realms, two entrances, and four aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are associated with all defilements.

Dharmas that are neither with a condition as object nor without a condition as object are included in eleven realms, eleven entrances, and two aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of others' minds. They are cognized by six consciousnesses. They are associated with defilements that take the contaminated as object. Four dharmas are finished.

The form aggregate is included in eleven realms, eleven entrances, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of others' minds and the knowledge of cessation. It is cognized by six consciousnesses. It is associated with the universal defilements of the two realms of desire and form, and with the defilements that are eliminated by cultivation.

The aggregates of feeling, perception, and formation are included in one realm, one entrance, and three aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are associated with all defilements.

The aggregate of consciousness is included in seven realms, one entrance, and one aggregate. It is known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is associated with all defilements.

The form aggregate is included in eleven realms, eleven entrances, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the minds of others and the knowledge of the path of cessation. It is cognized by six consciousnesses, and is influenced by the universal contaminants of the two realms of desire and form, as well as by the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

The feeling aggregate, perception aggregate, and formation aggregate are included in one realm, one entrance, and three aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the path of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness, and are influenced by all contaminants.

The consciousness aggregate is included in seven realms, one entrance, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the path of cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness, and is influenced by all contaminants.

The destinies of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, and humans are included in eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of subsequent cognition and the knowledge of the path of cessation. They are cognized by six consciousnesses, and are influenced by all contaminants of the desire realm.

The destiny of gods is included in eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. It is known by eight knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the path of cessation. It is cognized by six consciousnesses, and is influenced by all contaminants of the three realms.

The aggregate of afflictions eliminated by seeing suffering is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is afflicted by all the proclivities eliminated by seeing suffering and by all the universal proclivities.ğŸ”½The aggregate of afflictions eliminated by seeing the origin [of suffering] is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is afflicted by all the proclivities eliminated by seeing the origin [of suffering] and by all the universal proclivities.ğŸ”½The aggregate of afflictions eliminated by seeing cessation [of suffering] is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is afflicted by the proclivities eliminated by seeing cessation [of suffering] that have contaminated objects and by all the universal proclivities.

The aggregate of afflictions eliminated by seeing the path [to cessation of suffering] is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is afflicted by the proclivities eliminated by seeing the path [to cessation of suffering] that have contaminated objects and by all the universal proclivities.

The body of afflictions to be eliminated through cultivation is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is afflicted by all the propensities to be eliminated through cultivation and by all the pervasive propensities.
Form dharmas are like the aggregate of form.
Mind dharmas are like the aggregate of consciousness.

Mental factors are included in one realm, one sense base, and three aggregates. They are known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are afflicted by all the propensities.

Mental factors not associated with the mind are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of others' minds and the knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are afflicted by the propensities that take the contaminated as their object.
Unconditioned dharmas are extensively explained like the dharmas that are neither fruits nor causes of anything. The five dharmas are concluded here.

The earth element is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges except for the knowledge of others' minds and the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by two consciousnesses. It is afflicted by the pervasive propensities of the two realms of desire and form and by the propensities to be eliminated through cultivation.
The water element, fire element, wind element, and space element are also like this.

The consciousness element is included in seven elements, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is associated with all defilements.ğŸ”½Dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering are included in three realms, two sense bases, and four aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are associated with all defilements eliminated by seeing suffering, and with all pervasive defilements eliminated by seeing the origin.ğŸ”½Dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the origin are included in three realms, two sense bases, and four aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are associated with all defilements eliminated by seeing the origin, and with all pervasive defilements eliminated by seeing suffering.

Dharmas to be eliminated by seeing cessation are included in three realms, two sense bases, and four aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are associated with all defilements eliminated by seeing cessation, and with all pervasive defilements.ğŸ”½Dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the path are included in three realms, two sense bases, and four aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are associated with all defilements eliminated by seeing the path, and with all pervasive defilements.

The dharmas to be eliminated by the path of seeing are categorized as three realms, two entrances, and four aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are the influences of all the influences to be eliminated by the path of seeing, as well as the influences of all the universal influences.

The dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation are categorized as eighteen realms, twelve entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by six consciousnesses. They are the influences of all the influences to be eliminated by cultivation, as well as the influences of all the universal influences.

The undeled dharmas are categorized as three realms, two entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of suffering and the knowledge of the cause of suffering. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are not influenced by the influences.ğŸ”½The influences of craving and the influences of anger are categorized as one realm, one entrance, and one aggregate. They are known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of subsequent cognition and the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are the influences of the influences with impure objects in the desire realm.

The influences of craving for existence are categorized as one realm, one entrance, and one aggregate. They are known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of the principle and the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are the influences of the influences with impure objects in the form and formless realms.

The influxes of conceit are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate; they are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path; they are cognized by one consciousness; they are the influxes that flow in the three realms.

The influxes of ignorance are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate; they are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path; they are cognized by one consciousness; they are the influxes that flow in all except for ignorance with pure objects.

The influxes of views are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate; they are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path; they are cognized by one consciousness; they are the influxes that flow in the impure objects of views and the ignorance with pure objects associated with views.

The influxes of doubt are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate; they are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path; they are cognized by one consciousness; they are the influxes that flow in the impure objects of doubt and the ignorance with pure objects associated with doubt.

The first abode of consciousness is included in eighteen realms, twelve sense bases, and five aggregates; it is known by seven knowledges except for the knowledge of subsequent cognition and the knowledge of the path; it is cognized by six consciousnesses; it is influenced by all the influxes of the desire realm.

The second abode of consciousness is included in fourteen elements, ten entrances, and five aggregates, is known by seven knowledges excluding knowledge of dharmas and the knowledge of cessation and path, is cognized by four consciousnesses, and is fettered by all the defilements of the form realm.

The third and fourth abodes of consciousness are included in eleven elements, ten entrances, and five aggregates, are known by seven knowledges excluding knowledge of dharmas and the knowledge of cessation and path, are cognized by one consciousness, and are fettered by all the defilements of the form realm.

The fifth, sixth, and seventh abodes of consciousness are included in three elements, two entrances, and four aggregates, are known by six knowledges excluding knowledge of dharmas, knowledge of others' minds, and the knowledge of cessation and path, are cognized by one consciousness, and are fettered by all the defilements of the formless realm.

The seven factors of enlightenment are included in one element, one entrance, and two aggregates, are known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of suffering, accumulation, and cessation, are cognized by one consciousness, and are not fettered by the defilements. The seven factors are concluded.

The first, second, and third liberations are included in the three realms, two entrances, and five aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding knowledge of dharmas and knowledge of cessation and path. They are cognized by one consciousness, and are influenced by all the universal defilements and the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation of the form realm.ğŸ”½The liberation of the sphere of infinite space, the liberation of the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the liberation of the sphere of nothingness are included in the three realms, two entrances, and four aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding knowledge of dharmas, knowledge of others' minds, and knowledge of cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness, and are influenced by all the universal defilements and the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation of the formless realm.

The liberation of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is included in the three realms, two entrances, and four aggregates. It is known by six knowledges, excluding knowledge of dharmas, knowledge of others' minds, and knowledge of cessation and path. It is cognized by one consciousness, and is influenced by all the universal defilements and the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation of the formless realm.

The sphere of concentration that is the cessation of conceptualization and sensation is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by six knowledges, excluding the knowledge of dharmas, the knowledge of others' minds, and the knowledge of cessation and path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is a universal contaminant of the formless realm and a contaminant to be eliminated by cultivation.

The eight spheres of mastery and the eight spheres of totality are included in three realms, two sense bases, and five aggregates. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of dharmas, the knowledge of cessation, and the knowledge of path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are universal contaminants of the form realm and contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

Among the factors of the path, right speech, right action, and right livelihood are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by six knowledges, excluding the knowledge of others' minds and the knowledges of suffering, origin, and cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are not subject to contaminants.

The remaining factors of the path are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledges of suffering, origin, and cessation. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are not subject to contaminants. The eight dharmas are concluded here.

The fetters of greed and conceit are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. They are cognized by one consciousness. They are the contaminants of the three realms that have impure objects as their objects.

The fetter of ill-will is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges except for the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the contaminants of the desire realm that have impure objects as their objects.
The fetter of ignorance is the same as the contaminants of ignorance.

The fetter of views is the same as the contaminants of views.ğŸ”½The fetter of adherence is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the contaminants that are abandoned by the path of seeing and have impure objects as their objects.

The fetter of doubt is included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the contaminants that are abandoned by the path of seeing and have impure objects as their objects, as well as the ignorance that is associated with doubt and has pure objects as its objects.

The two fetters of stinginess and jealousy are categorized as one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of cessation. They are discerned by one consciousness. They are the contaminants of the desire realm that are universal and those that are not universal.
The first abode of sentient beings is like the first abode of consciousness.
The second abode of sentient beings is like the second abode of consciousness.
The third, fourth, and fifth abodes of sentient beings are like the third, fourth, and fifth abodes of consciousness.
The remaining abodes of sentient beings are like the remaining abodes of consciousness.

The sphere of infinite space and the sphere of infinite consciousness are categorized as three realms, two sense bases, and four aggregates. They are known by six knowledges excluding the knowledge of the dharma, the knowledge of the minds of others, and the knowledge of cessation and the path. They are discerned by one consciousness. They are the universal contaminants of the formless realm and the contaminants that are not universal.

In the dharmas of no-more-learning, right speech, right action, and right livelihood are categorized as one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by six knowledges excluding the knowledge of the ending of outflows, the knowledge of others' minds, and the knowledge of suffering, origin, and cessation. They are discerned by one consciousness and are not associated with contaminants.
The remaining dharmas of no-more-learning are the same as the remaining branches of the path. Ten dharmas are finished.

Contaminated form is categorized as eleven realms, eleven sense bases, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of the ending of outflows, the knowledge of others' minds, and the knowledge of cessation and path. It is discerned by six consciousnesses and is associated with contaminants of the two realms of desire and form, as well as contaminants eliminated by cultivation.

Contaminated feeling, conceptualization, and volition are categorized as one realm, one sense base, and three aggregates. They are known by eight knowledges excluding the knowledge of cessation and path. They are discerned by one consciousness and are associated with all contaminants.
Contaminated consciousness is the same as the realm of consciousness.

Pure form is categorized as one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by six knowledges excluding the knowledge of the ending of outflows, the knowledge of others' minds, and the knowledge of suffering, origin, and cessation. It is discerned by one consciousness and is not associated with contaminants.

The formless aggregates of feeling, perception, and formations associated with the uncontaminated path are included in one element, one sense base, and three aggregates, are known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledges of suffering, origin, and cessation, are cognized by one consciousness, and are not associated with contaminants.

The uncontaminated consciousness aggregate is included in two elements, one sense base, and one aggregate, is known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledges of suffering, origin, and cessation, is cognized by one consciousness, and is not associated with contaminants.
The unconditioned dharmas are explained in detail like the dharmas that are not results of the five destinies.

The eye sense base is included in one element, one sense base, and one aggregate, is known by seven knowledges excluding the knowledge of the minds of others and the knowledge of the path, is cognized by one consciousness, and is associated with contaminants of the two realms of desire and form, and with contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

Like the eye sense base, the ear sense base, nose sense base, tongue sense base, body sense base, eye element, ear element, nose element, tongue element, body element, eye faculty, ear faculty, nose faculty, tongue faculty, and body faculty are also like this.

The form sense base is included in one element, one sense base, and one aggregate; it is known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the ending of contamination, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of the mental activities of others; it is the object of two consciousnesses; it is related to the contaminants of the two realms of desire and form, and to the contaminants to be abandoned by cultivation.
As is the form sense base, so are the sound sense base, the tangible sense base, the form element, the sound element, and the tangible element.

The smell sense base is included in one element, one sense base, and one aggregate; it is known by six knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the subsequent class, the knowledge of the mental activities of others, and the knowledge of the path; it is the object of two consciousnesses; it is related to the contaminants of the realm of desire, and to the contaminants to be abandoned by cultivation.
As is the smell sense base, so are the taste sense base, the smell element, and the taste element.

The mind sense base is included in seven elements, one sense base, and one aggregate; it is known by nine knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the cessation of suffering; it is the object of one consciousness; it is related to all contaminants.
As is the mind sense base, so are the mind element and the mind faculty.
The dharma sense base is included in one element, one sense base, and four aggregates; it is known by ten knowledges; it is the object of one consciousness; it is related to all contaminants.
Entering in accordance with the Dharma, the Dharma realm is also like this. The twelve dharmas are concluded here.

The eye-consciousness element is included in two elements, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by eight knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the object of the universal contaminants of the desire and form realms, as well as the object of the contaminants to be abandoned by cultivation.
As with the eye-consciousness element, the ear-consciousness element and the body-consciousness element are also like this.

The nose-consciousness element is included in two elements, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges except for subsequent knowledge and the knowledge of cessation and the path. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the object of the universal contaminants of the desire realm, as well as the object of the contaminants to be abandoned by cultivation.
As with the nose-consciousness element, the tongue-consciousness element is also like this.

The mind-consciousness element is included in two elements, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is the object of all contaminants. The eighteen dharmas are concluded here.

The female faculty is included in one element, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by six knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of the cessation, and the knowledge of others' minds. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is related to the contaminants of the desire realm, the universal contaminants, and the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.
As with the female faculty, the male faculty is also like this.

The life faculty is included in one element, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the cessation and the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of others' minds. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is related to the contaminants of the three realms, the universal contaminants, and the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

The faculty of pleasure is included in one element, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by nine knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is related to the contaminants of the form realm, the universal contaminants of the desire realm, and the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

The faculty of pain is included in one element, one sense base, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of the cessation, and the knowledge of others' minds. It is cognized by one consciousness. It is related to the universal contaminants of the desire realm and the contaminants to be eliminated by cultivation.

The faculty of joy is categorized as one sense base, one sense sphere, and one aggregate. It is known by nine knowledges except for the knowledge of cessation. It is discerned by one consciousness. It is related to all the passions of the realm of form, except for doubt and ignorance associated with it, and the passions of the realm of desire that are not related to the passions that have objects in the realm of desire and the realm of form.

The faculty of sorrow is categorized as one sense base, one sense sphere, and one aggregate. It is known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of cessation. It is discerned by one consciousness. It is related to all the passions of the realm of desire.

The faculty of indifference is categorized as one sense base, one sense sphere, and one aggregate. It is known by nine knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation. It is discerned by one consciousness. It is related to all the passions.

The faculty of faith is categorized as one sense base, one sense sphere, and one aggregate. It is known by nine knowledges, excluding the knowledge of cessation. It is discerned by one consciousness. It is related to all the passions of the three realms that are eliminated by the path of cultivation.

analyzed: å¦‚ä¿¡æ ¹ï¼Œç²¾é€²æ ¹ã€å¿µæ ¹ã€å®šæ ¹ã€æ…§æ ¹äº¦å¦‚æ˜¯ã€‚
translated: As is the faculty of faith, so are the faculties of zeal, mindfulness, concentration, and insight.

The faculty of understanding what has not been understood is included in three realms, two entrances, and three aggregates; it is known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origination, and the knowledge of cessation; it is cognized by one consciousness; it is not related to the contaminants.

As is the faculty of understanding what has not been understood, so are the faculty of understanding and the faculty of possessing complete knowledge.ğŸ”½The contaminants to be eliminated by [the path of] seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm are included in one realm, one entrance, and one aggregate; they are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of subsequent cognition and the knowledge of the path and cessation; they are cognized by one consciousness; they are related to all the contaminants to be eliminated by [the path of] seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm, and to all the universal contaminants.

The contaminants to be eliminated by [the path of] seeing the truth of origination in the desire realm are included in one realm, one entrance, and one aggregate; they are known by seven knowledges, excluding the knowledge of subsequent cognition and the knowledge of the path and cessation; they are cognized by one consciousness; they are related to all the contaminants to be eliminated by [the path of] seeing the truth of origination in the desire realm, and to all the universal contaminants.

The fetters belonging to the desire realm and eliminated by seeing cessation are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding subsequent knowledge and the knowledge of cessation and the path. They are cognized by one consciousness, excluding the impurities of the desire realm that are eliminated by seeing cessation, the non-universal ignorance with pure objects, and the fetters of the desire realm that are eliminated by seeing cessation.ğŸ”½The fetters belonging to the desire realm and eliminated by seeing the path are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding subsequent knowledge and the knowledge of cessation and the path. They are cognized by one consciousness, excluding the impurities of the desire realm that are eliminated by seeing the path, the non-universal ignorance with pure objects, and the fetters of the desire realm that are eliminated by seeing the path.

The fetters belonging to the desire realm and eliminated by cultivation are included in one realm, one sense base, and one aggregate. They are known by seven knowledges, excluding subsequent knowledge and the knowledge of cessation and the path. They are cognized by one consciousness, and are the fetters of the desire realm that are eliminated by cultivation and the universal fetters.
As for the fetters belonging to the desire realm, so too are those belonging to the form realm and formless realm.
As for the distinctions in the form realm, exclude the knowledge of dharmas.
As for the distinctions in the formless realm, six knowledges know, excluding the knowledge of dharmas, the knowledge of others' minds, the knowledge of cessation, and the knowledge of the path.
The rest is as explained above. The ninety-eight latent afflictions are finished.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
